metadata.title: CVE-2018-2784 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.39 and prior and5.7.21 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-2784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmariadbd18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.22-0ubuntu18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
